idea.title: Deal Vault — Brand deal dashboard for college athletes
idea.summary: NIL deal management platform for college athletes. Centralizes brand partnerships, auto-extracts contract terms from DMs, tracks payments and deadlines, generates compliance reports.
idea.healthcareAngle: Not directly healthcare — but the pattern is powerful: a governance + tracking layer for a chaotic new market with compliance requirements. That's exactly what Lumen SDK does for clinical AI. Validates the thesis that runtime governance layers are needed wherever high-stakes decisions meet regulatory pressure.
idea.verdictNote: Skip for building, but validates your thesis.

articles.title: Healthcare IT Leaders Get Real on the State of AI in 2026
articles.takeaway: Seven CIOs surveyed post-pilot. Nursing staff excited to leverage AI for care model reimagination. Orgs piloting agentic AI for chart review, discharge summaries, clinical registry abstraction. CHAI's head of operations quoted — your SDK aligns directly with their framework.
articles.linkedinAngle: The gap between pilot enthusiasm and production governance is where FORGE Health lives. These CIOs are excited — but who's ensuring defensibility at runtime?

articles.title: AI in Health Care: 26 Leaders Offer Predictions for 2026
articles.takeaway: 26 executives predict wider, more intentional AI adoption. Key quote: 'Those who ground their decisions in shared, defensible information will move faster and earn far greater trust.' Patients already running notes through ChatGPT with zero governance.
articles.linkedinAngle: Defensible information is the new competitive advantage in healthcare AI. The question isn't whether to adopt — it's whether you can prove your AI made the right call.

articles.title: From Agents to Governance: Essential AI Skills for Clinicians in the LLM Era
articles.takeaway: Peer-reviewed paper proposing a 3-tier competency framework for clinicians using LLMs. Covers bias detection, security, accountability, prompt engineering. The academic world is catching up to what Lumen SDK already does — runtime governance for clinical AI.
articles.linkedinAngle: Academia is building frameworks. But frameworks don't enforce themselves. What happens at the moment a clinical AI produces a recommendation? That's the gap.

linkedin.author: Joshua Liu, MD
linkedin.insight: 15 takeaways from Nabla's Healthcare AI Executive Summit. Key points: (1) As ambient AI floods systems, automated Clinical Decision Support raises questions about over-controlling physicians — this is the exact tension Lumen SDK resolves. (2) AI may soon be like ultrasound — malpractice NOT to use it, making defensibility mandatory. (3) AI-draft patient messages only used 20% of time — clinicians need trust, not just output.

quote.text: Leaders who are willing to adjust and keep their vision future-focused will separate themselves from the pack in 2026.
quote.author: Tony Galati
quote.reflection: You left Microsoft. You built Lumen. You're talking to an AI at 5am about go-to-market strategy. You're already separated from the pack. Now it's about finishing what you started.
